content:
That's a great approach! Starting with one shop and growing from there will give you a chance to get a feel for the platform, test the waters, and see how your products resonate with customers.

I'm thrilled to hear that the art exhibit inspired you! Impressionist art is known for its captivating use of light and color, and it's wonderful that you're finding inspiration in it. The play of light and color can add so much depth and emotion to a piece, and it's exciting that you're feeling motivated to explore these elements in your own art.

Flipping through the book you bought at the gift shop must be a great way to revisit the exhibit and absorb more of the details. Sometimes, seeing the artwork in person can be overwhelming, and having a book or catalog can help you appreciate the nuances of the pieces even more.

What kind of art projects are you planning to work on, inspired by the exhibit? Are you looking to create something similar in style, or do you want to incorporate impressionist elements into your existing style?
